captions.text: Woman: "I don't really know if this is our thing".  Man: "I kinda like it..."
Woman: "Change your shirt you look ridiculous."  Man: "I like this shirt".
Man: "Are you ready?" Woman: "We're not gunna be late, I just...I hate my hair."
Man: "We don't have that much time."  Woman: "Staying in sounds nice actually."
Man: "Was that you or me?"   Woman: " I don't know.."
Man: "Thanksgiving in Las Vegas, I was at the MGM Grand, it was all dumb old people."
Woman: "I was telling Neil how great the job interview went, and he says... Oh you have to act like a dude in a job interview if you want them to take you seriously."
Man: "I never said that."  Woman: "Yes you did".  Man: "Okay, I said that."
Woman: "Hey baby, I have to go to work early."  Man: "You're breath smells like garbage for some reason."
Woman: "Ha, your breath is so bad."

even The Princes Bride. we have wasted our time.
that, and every saturday we still sit in front of the TV, eating Ramen 
noodles, and watch our favorite anime(s). God i miss 2006. that's when me 
and my brother were still on speaking terms...﻿

comments.author: Wendy Alien

comments.text:
+Wendy Alien I disagree. Look at any couple that have been together for 
years. Not just one or two though... Decades. And you tell me how loved up 
they are all the time. You don't have to be on each other like a rash 
constantly and acting like honeymooners to be deeply in love with someone. 
It's the little things. It depends on your love languages. If you 
communicate love without saying it or making it obvious then that's you and 
your partner's business. it doesn't matter how/if anyone else sees it or 
understands it.
comments.author: XantheG2010

comments.text:

it shows if they have to rely on these silly mechanisms to have ineraction 
then it's not good and they don't have a Devine connection

comments.text:
just because it isn't overly romanticized like in movies doesn't mean it's
